AT the beginning of the whole poem Lucretius explains that he has three main subjects to treat of: these are the Atomic Theory, the Cosmology, and the Psychology, of the Epicurean system. He gives us to understand that of these three the last is the most importantl. These three subjects cover the ground of the Physics, or, as we should say, Natural Science, of Epi- curus.

The Epicurean system ol philosophy, like that of the Stoics, may be divided into three parts, Logic, PhysicS, and Ethics. But Logic or, as Epicurus preferred to call it, Canonic2, plays a very subordinate part in the system. lts chief business is to lay down the general principles on which we are entitled to assert anything astrue.
